institution-wrap.institution: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases

funding-group.funding-statement: All grants listed below were received by Ashley Hazel and contributed to supporting fieldwork for data collection. GRANTS FROM THE UNIVERSITY OF MICHIGAN: 1) International Research Award, University of Michigan Rackham Graduate School, P.I., $7,500; 2) Complex Systems Approaches to Population Health & Health Inequalities, University of Michigan Center for the Study of Complex Systems and The Center for Social Epidemiology and Public Health, P.I., $7,620; 3) Graduate Student Research Grant (candidate level), University of Michigan Rackham Graduate School, P.I., $3000; 4) Thesis and Dissertation Research Funding (candidate level), University of Michigan School of Natural Resources and Environment, P.I., $1,500. GRANTS FROM EXTERNAL FOUNDATIONS: 5) Dissertation Fieldwork Grant, Wenner-Gren Foundation for Anthropological Research, P.I., $19,420; 6) Health & Society Small Grant Program, Robert Wood Johnson Foundation, P.I., $20, 565; 7) Lewis & Clark Fund for Exploration and Field Research, The American Philosophical Society, P.I., $5,000. GOVERNMENT SUPPORT: 8) NIH training grant (NIH training grant T32 AI049816): Interdisciplinary Program in Infectious Diseases (PI: Prof. Betsy Foxman). The funders had no role in study design, data collection and analysis, decision to publish, or preparation of the manuscript.
